About this site

title: Hands-on Exercise 01
text:
The code chunk below uses pacman package to check if tidyverse is installed. If it is installed, it will be launched. Otherwise pacman will install the it automatically.

pacman::p_load(tidyverse)





exam_data <- read_csv('data/Exam_data.csv')

Rows: 322 Columns: 7
── Column specification ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
Delimiter: ","
chr (4): ID, CLASS, GENDER, RACE
dbl (3): ENGLISH, MATHS, SCIENCE

ℹ Use `spec()` to retrieve the full column specification for this data.
ℹ Specify the column types or set `show_col_types = FALSE` to quiet this message.








ggplot(data = exam_data, aes(x = RACE)) + 
    geom_bar()

title: Hands-on Exercise 00: working with tidyverse
text:
Load tidyverse onto r environment by using the code chunck below.

pacman::p_load(tidyverse)

title: Hands-on Exercise 00: working with tidyverse
text:
Load tidyverse onto r environment by using the code chunck below.

pacman::p_load(tidyverse)

title: Hands-on Exercise 00: working with tidyverse
text:
Importing data
Code chunk below uses read_csv() or readr to import REALIS2019.csv into environment as a tibble data.frame

realis_csv <- read.csv("data/REALIS2019.csv")


realis2019 <- read_csv("data/REALIS2019.csv")


popdata_fat <- read_csv("data/PopData2019_fat.csv")

title: Hands-on Exercise 00: working with tidyverse
text:
Pivoting Data

popdata_long <- popdata_fat %>%
  pivot_longer(c(3:21),
        names_to = "Age Group",
        values_to = "Population")


write_rds(popdata_long,"data/rds/popdata_long.rds")

title: Hands-on Exercise 00: working with tidyverse
text:
Working with dplyr

realis2019_selected <- realis2019 %>% 
  select('Project Name',
  'Transacted Price ($)',
  'Type of Sale',
  'Unit Price ($ psm)',
  'Property Type')
realis2019_selected

# A tibble: 19,515 × 5
   `Project Name`     `Transacted Price ($)` `Type of Sale` `Unit Price ($ psm)`
   <chr>                               <dbl> <chr>                         <dbl>
 1 PEIRCE VIEW                        840000 Resale                         7434
 2 FLORIDA PARK                      3040000 Resale                         9737
 3 BULLION PARK                       860000 Resale                        11467
 4 CASTLE GREEN                      1000000 Resale                         9346
 5 HAPPY ESTATE                      7000000 Resale                        10183
 6 TEACHER'S HOUSING…                2880000 Resale                        12659
 7 THE PANORAMA                      1510000 Resale                        16064
 8 THE PANORAMA                       710000 Resale                        16905
 9 CHIP THYE GARDEN                  2800000 Resale                        13500
10 TEACHER'S HOUSING…                2300000 Resale                         9935
# ℹ 19,505 more rows
# ℹ 1 more variable: `Property Type` <chr>



Working with filter() of dplyr

realis2019_filtered <- realis2019_selected %>%
  filter('Property Type' == "Condominium" |
           'Property Type' == "Apartment") %>%
  filter('Type of Sale' == "New Sale") %>%
  filter('Unit Price ($ psm)' <= 13000)



Putting it all together

realis2019_end <- realis2019 %>% 
  select('Project Name',
  'Transacted Price ($)',
  'Type of Sale',
  'Unit Price ($ psm)',
  'Property Type') %>%
  filter('Property Type' == "Condominium" |
           'Property Type' == "Apartment") %>%
  filter('Type of Sale' == "New Sale") %>%
  filter('Unit Price ($ psm)' <= 13000)

title: ISSS608
text:
Welcome to ISSS608 Visual Analytic and Applications. In this website, you will find my coursework prepared for the course.
Please refer to the Hands-on Exercise 0 completed for the preparation of the course.
